DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Successful LITT Treatment MRI Result Percent Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the percentage of the lesion that was successfully treated using the Laser Interstitial Thermal Therapy procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lesion Success Laser Interstitial Thermal Therapy Magnetic Resonance Imaging Percent Unit Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._An event that accomplishes its intended purpose._A thermal ablation therapy in which neoplasms are heated with prolonged and moderate temperature elevations.  It results in coagulative necrosis in the heated tissue._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred)._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredName: Success Laser Interstitial Thermal Therapy Magnetic Resonance Imaging Percent Unit Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.:A thermal ablation therapy in which neoplasms are heated with prolonged and moderate temperature elevations.  It results in coagulative necrosis in the heated tissue.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.:A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.
A thermal ablation therapy in which neoplasms are heated with prolonged and moderate temperature elevations.  It results in coagulative necrosis in the heated tissue.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.origin: DCI CRF:  Duke Cancer Institute Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for LITT Form in Rave. mc 1/20/17

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed with a max of 5 characters and 2 decimals, units of measure not specified.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
